data: PED ENDO Non-Diabetes Related Hypoglycemia
Status
This powerplan applies to children greater than or equal to 3 months of age who do NOT have diabetes mellitus and who have a blood sugar less than 3.5 mmol/L or 4 mmol/L with hypoglycemia symptoms
Please refer to PED ENDO Hypoglcemia for Patients with Diabetes Mellitus (Module) if needed
Patient Care
Vital Signs
PRN
Insert Peripheral IV Catheter
T;N
Notify Treating Provider
Notify provider if patient cannot tolerate oral glucose / feed or is unconscious and/or seizing without IV access
Diet/Nutrition
If patient is alert and can be treated with oral feed or glucose
For patients 3 to 12 months of age with blood sugar 3 to 4 mmol/L
Communication Order
If POC Glucose Whole Blood  3 mmol/L  treat with oral feed and recheck blood glucose in 30 minute
If POC Glucose Whole Blood  3.1 mmol/L  treat with oral feed and recheck blood glucose in 30 minute
If POC Glucose Whole Blood  3.2 mmol/L  treat with oral feed and recheck blood glucose in 30 minute
If POC Glucose Whole Blood  3.3 mmol/L  treat with oral feed and recheck blood glucose in 30 minute
If POC Glucose Whole Blood  3.4 mmol/L  treat with oral feed and recheck blood glucose in 30 minute
If POC Glucose Whole Blood  3.5 mmol/Lwith symptoms of hypoglycemia treat with oral feed and recheck blood glucose in 30 minute
If POC Glucose Whole Blood  3.6 mmol/L with symptoms of hypoglycemia treat with oral feed and recheck blood glucose in 30 minute
If POC Glucose Whole Blood  3.7 mmol/L with sympoms of hypoglyceima treat with oral feed and recheck blood glucose in 30 minute
If POC Glucose Whole Blood  3.8 mmol/L with symptoms of hypoglycemia treat with oral feed and recheck blood glucose in 30 minute
If POC Glucose Whole Blood  3.9 mmol/L with symptoms of hypoglycemia treat with oral feed and recheck blood glucose in 30 minute
If POC Glucose Whole Blood  4 mmol/L with symptopms of hypoglycemia  treat with oral feed and recheck blood glucose in 30 minute
Infant Formula
Feed Ad Lib
If repeat blood glucose less than 3 mmol/L
Communication Order
If repeat POC Glucose Whole Blood less then 3 mmol/L following step 1 management. notify provider
Communication Order
If repeat POC Glucose Whole Blood  less than 3 mmol/L following step 1 management, adminster PO glucose 6 g
Communication Order
If repeat POC Glucose Whole Blood less than 3 mmol/L following step 1 management, administer glucagon
Communication Order
If repeat POC Glucose Whole Blood is greater than or equal to 3.5 mmol/L following step 1 management, no further action needed
If repeat POC Glucose Whole Blood is greater than or equal to 3.5 mmol/L following step 1 management, no further action needed
Communication Order
If repeat POC Glucose Whole Blood is greater than or equal to 3.5 mmol/L following step 1 management, recheck blood sugar in 30 minute and notify provider if result is less than 3.5 mmol/L
If repeat blood glucose 3 to 3.5 mmol/L
Communication Order
If repeat POC Glucose Whole Blood is 3 mmol/L following Step 2 management, notify provider
